result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue
Mailed  to defendant on 11/01/22.
NOC, JFFO, and NEJ mailed to def 4/9/2020.

02:12 PM Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by telephone.  Richard D Trzebiatowski appeared by video means. 20CF67 and 15CF120 called. 15CF120 sentence after revocation on ct 2. Plea and sentencing on20CF67. Agreement stated - 20CF67, information filed, same charges, copy was faxed to Def at jail. Def will plead to ct 1 and 2, ct 3 dri. Recommendation on cts 1 & 2 - withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation on each, cc, costs, DNA, AODA and follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, no presence in places with Class B liquor license, maintain full time employment/school, counseling deemed necessary. 15CF120, State has reviewed summary, no corrections or additions. On ct 2 -1 yr jail.20CF67 - 48 days credit. 15CF120 - 66 days credit. Def heard and agrees. Court reviews Def's right to be present in courtroom and explains reason for video appearance. Def understands and wishes to proceed. Def can hear and understand. Court advises Def to interrupt if can't hear. Def reviewed copy of revocation packet. Court reviews waiver of prelim hrg w/Def. Court finds waiver knowing and voluntary, finds probable cause and binds over in 20CF67. Def waives reading of information. Plea quest. reviewed. (unsigned) 20CF67 ct 1 - guilty plea, ct 2 - guilty plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 3. Constitutional rights reviewed. Court verifies w/Def that also waiving right to atty on 15CF120. Elements and possible penalties on 20CF67 reviewed. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds Def guilty of 20CF67 cts 1 & 2. State gives sentencing remarks. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow recommendation. Orders on 20CF67 On cts 1 & 2 - w/held sentence on each, 3 yrs probation, costs, DNA surcharge, DNA sample if not already on file, AODA and follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, no presence in places with Class B liquor license, maintain full time employment 30 hrs/wk or actively seeking employment, counseling deemed necessary. 48 day days credit if revoked. 15CF120 ct 2 - 12 months jail, huber, credit for 66 days served. Convert any outstanding court costs to civil judgment. Postconviction rights. Def advised of firearms and voting rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court calls 20CF67 & 15CF120  @ 09:39 AM Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by telephone.  Richard D Trzebiatowski appeared by video means. Def. is pending revocation on 15CF120 & 20CF67 is new case. 20CF67 Waiver of attorney rights filed however, will apply also on 15-CF120. 3-27-2020 Waiver was signed. Court goes over form with defendant. Def. still wants to represent himself. Court finds waiver is freely & voluntarily given and will allow def. to represent himself on 15CF120 & 20CF67. DA will send offer to defendant.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2020 at 10:00 am.

Court calls 15CF120 & 17CF224 @ 10:06 am.   am. Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Courtney Imig, intern also appears.  State gives plea agreement,  17CF224, ct 1 DRI, ct 2 plea, ct 3 plea, ct 4 DRI, 15CF120 Ct 1 SAR, ct 2 DEJ, revoke ct 3 SAR.   15CF120 Revocation in  ct 1 6 months jail, & ct 3 30 days jail, concurrent to ct 1, 17CF224 ct 2 2 yrs prison,  12 months initial confinement, 12 months extended supervision  imposed & stay  5 years probation, costs, DNA Surcharge, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation,  100 hours community service,  Absolute Sobriety, Maintain full time employment/school 35 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, counseling deemed necessary   ct 3  2 yrs prison, consecutive 12 months initial confinement, 12 month extended supervision, impose and stay 5 years probation costs and follow same conditions, 15CF120 ct 2 withheld sentence 5 years probation concurrent, costs, DNA And comply with same conditions in 17CF224.  State and Atty Laufenberg received revocation summary packet and no corrections.    17CF224 Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed electronically.  Atty Laufenberg received copy of information and waives reading.  Plea questionnaire and waiver and rights filed. Def. understands charges and penalties.  Ct 2 Guilty, Ct 3 Guilty plea. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. right. DRI in ct 1 & 4 in 17CF224. Def. understands elements. Atty Laufenberg is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Ct 2 Poss of Meth, ptac, ct 3 Maintain Drg Trafficking place, 2nd, ptac.  State gives sentencing recommendation. 123 days credit in 17CF224, and 137 days credit in 15CF120.  Atty Laufenberg gives sentencing recommendation. Def. makes statement.  Court orders on 
15CF120 ct 1 6 months jail, ct 3 30 days jail, concurrent to each other, Court obligations converted to civil judgment.  138 days credit.  
15CF120 ct 2 Court revokes, withheld sentence 5 years probation , costs, waive DNA surcharge and  AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation,  100 hours community service,  Absolute Sobriety, Maintain full time employment/35 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, counseling deemed by agent. 
17CF224 ct 2 - 2 yrs prison,  1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision  imposed & stay  5 years probation, costs, 250 DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample, all same conditions and only 100 hours c.s. total, 123 days credit if revoked. 
ct 3 - 2 yrs prison,  1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision, consecutive impose and stay 5 years probation costs, waive DNA Surcharge and  same conditions,  except 100 hours community service.  Def. needs to start paying on atty fees.  1st payment due in Feb.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. Def is eligible for Substance Program and not eligible for Challenge Program. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advised of postconviction rights. Credit for 15CF120 only is for Ct's 1 & 3.

Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 10:06 am.  State gives plea agreement, plea to ct 1 as amended Poss of 961.41(3g)(e), & Ct. 2 & Ct 3, Defer Judgment Agreement on ct 2, Ct's 1 & 3 withheld sentence 2 years probation,  costs, AODA & follow through, Ct 4 DRI.  Atty Laufenberg agrees with plea agreement. Def. agrees with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed.   Def. understands charge and penalties.  Court grants amendment to Simple Poss of THC, 961.41(3g)(e), no contest plea, ct 2 Maintaining Drg Trafficking Place, no contest plea, Ct 3 Poss Drg Paraph, no contest plea, Ct 4 DRI. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Laufenberg is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea on Poss of THC, in ct 1,  and Poss of Drg Paraph in ct 3, however, will accept Deferred Agreement on Ct 2. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Atty Laufenberg gives sentencing recommendations. Def. has nothing to say. 
Court orders on ct 1 withheld sentence 2 years probation, costs, AODA and follow through recommendations, 200 DNA Surcharge, No credit
withheld sentence 2 years probation, costs, same conditions, 200 DNA Surcharge. Def. needs to continue to pay and if any balance on atty fees will be applied to costs.  Ct 2 Deferred Judgment for 2 years and signs order.   Atty Laufenberg questions if def. needs to continue to pay.  Court is finding def. Guilty in ct's 1 & 3. Atty Laufenberg is okay with amounts already paid.  Court finds def. does not have to continue to pay on payment plan. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. DNA Sample. Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Review hearing scheduled for August 9, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:10 p.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:48 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Judicial Pretrial - in court at 02-22-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 4:05 p.m. Was scheduled for plea/sentencing, however, Def would like to consult another attorney and requests adjournment. Court will grant one month adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court on 15CF120.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Stacy J. Trzebiatowski, in court on 15CF121, Defendant Billiejean Herman in court on 15CF122.   Court calls 15CF120, 15CF121 & 15CF122 @ 3:18 pm.  Atty Roley is not present & all 3 case were set for plea & sentencing today.  Court explains history on scheduling of these 3 case. Defendants & court are frustrated.  State suggest court to have Order to show cause to explain why not in court.  Court authorize Order to Show Cause on atty & will  summons to show court why not in court & will not be found in contempt or purge.   Court will set.  Defendants will get copy of notice on order to show cause, parties don't have to appear.  Parties will get new date in mail, all parties address is current.

Court calls 15CF120, 15CF121 & 15CF122 @ 8:48 am. Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Defendant Stacy J. Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Thomas Roley.  Defendant Billiejean Herman in court with attorney Thomas Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin on all 3 cases.  15CF121 State will be dismiss ct 3 on Ms. Herman case, so need for preliminary hearing.  Court would like to go over with defendant's regarding conflict of interest having Atty Roley representing all of them.  Ms. Herman understands conflict, Mr. Trzebiatowski, understands conflict, Mrs. Trzebiatowski, understands conflict.  Court orders Atty Roley to provide a written waiver with def's signature before next hearing. All 3 parties wish to have Atty Roley represent them. 15CF122 State moves to dismiss ct 3 w/o prejudice.  Atty Roley enters Not Guilty pleas, Court will dismiss w/o prejudice, ct 3 & receives not guilty plea on ct's 1 & 2. Mr. Herman leaves the courtroom. 15CF120 & 15CF121 Continue to preliminary hearing. Daniel Bauknecht, Inv for Langlade County Sheriff's Dept., duly sworn on oath, testifies. Exh # 1 - Chain of evidence log.  Exh # 1 Admitted & received.  Defense has nothing more.  State needs to amend ct 1.  Court finds probable cause on both cases & binds over.  Recess @ 9:10 am.  Reconvene @ 9:20 am. on 15CF120 & 15CF121 Informations filed on both cases.  Atty Roley has copy of informations, waives reading & enters Not Guilty plea to all ct's in each case. Court withdraws informations. off the record @ 9:22 am. back on the record @ 9:29 am.  Informations filed on both cases.  Atty Roley has copy of informations, waives reading & enters Not Guilty plea to all ct's on each case.  Court will direct clerk to enter Not Guilty pleas to 4 ct's on both cases.  15CF122 to be set for Status on 9-21-15 @ 3:30 pm. Court verifies DOB on record & corrects.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Richard D Trzebiatowski in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:25 pm. Atty Roley has copy of complaint, waives reading.  Court accepts waiver of reading. State heard on bond. Atty Roley does not object. Court orders $2500.00 Signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
